etymologies: early 20th century: from German Peptid, back-formation from Polypeptid ‘polypeptide’

definitions: a compound consisting of two or more amino acids linked in a chain, the carboxyl group of each acid being joined to the amino group of the next by a bond of the type OCNH.
shortDefinitions: compound consisting of two or more amino acids linked in chain, carboxyl group of each acid being joined to amino group of next by bond
